title: NavRAT
descrption: NavRAT is a remote access tool designed to upload, download, and execute files. It has been observed in attacks targeting South Korea. [1]

references.title: Mercer, W., Rascagneres, P. (2018, May 31). NavRAT Uses US-North Korea Summit As Decoy For Attacks In South Korea. Retrieved June 11, 2018.

related.Name: Command-Line Interface
related.Use: NavRAT leverages cmd.exe to perform discovery techniques.[1]

related.Name: Data Staged
related.Use: NavRAT writes multiple outputs to a TMP file using the >> method.[1]

related.Name: Input Capture
related.Use: NavRAT logs the keystrokes on the targeted system.[1]

related.Name: Process Discovery
related.Use: NavRAT uses tasklist /v to check running processes.[1]

related.Name: Process Injection
related.Use: NavRAT copies itself into a running Internet Explorer process to evade detection.[1]

related.Name: Registry Run Keys / Startup Folder
related.Use: NavRAT creates a Registry key to ensure a file gets executed upon reboot in order to establish persistence.[1]

related.Name: Scripting
related.Use: NavRAT loads malicious shellcode and executes it in memory.[1]

related.Name: Standard Application Layer Protocol
related.Use: NavRAT uses the email platform, Naver, for C2 communications, leveraging SMTP.[1]

related.Name: System Information Discovery
related.Use: NavRAT uses systeminfo on a victim’s machine.[1]

related.Name: APT37
related.References: NavRAT is linked to APT37 with medium confidence.[1]
